text:
• Preinstallation checklist ensures all accessories are correctly reinstalled
• Battery must be fully charged before engine installation
• Prelube engine and verify proper oil pressure

• Bell housing must be properly torqued to prevent cylinder distortion
• Clutch friction disc requires alignment tool during installation
• Always adjust clutch free play before starting engine

• Torque converter splines must engage all transmission shafts
• Install torque converter on transmission before mounting to engine
• Rotate converter to ensure no binding before securing

• Engine secured with sling attached to manifold or lifting brackets
• Ensure engine is supported and balanced properly before installation

• Rear-wheel drive: engine tipped to allow transmission entry first
• Transmission worked under floor pan as engine is lowered
• Front and rear engine mounts aligned and torqued

• Front-wheel drive: often installed from underneath on cradle
• Entire drivetrain package placed back while attached to cradle
• Vehicle positioned on hoist and lowered onto engine assembly
• Dressing the engine involves attaching all auxiliary items: starter motor, fuel rail, oxygen sensors, wiring harness, ignition components, and belt-driven accessories

• Engine should start on fully charged battery without jumper
• As soon as engine starts and shows oil pressure, bring to fast idle speed
• Maintain fast idle to ensure proper lubrication

• Check valve train quiet operation
• Record engine vacuum (17-21 inHg at sea level)
• Check for gasoline, coolant, or oil leaks

• Accelerate full throttle from 30-50 mph, then close throttle to return to 30 mph
• Repeat 10-12 times to seat piston rings
• Good ring seating indicated by dry coating in tailpipe

• Normal operating temperature reached when upper radiator hose is hot and pressurized
• Electric cooling fan should cycle on and off at least once
• Some manufacturers require two cycles

• Never add cold water to cooling system while engine running
• Never lug engine - avoid low speed in high gear
• Change oil and filter at 500 miles or 20 hours of operation
